CatDescriptText: Attorney Byrd Brown (1929-2001) son of Judge Homer S. Brown, was president of the Pittsburgh branch of the NAACP from 1958 to 1971. He ran for congress in 1970, and for Mayor of Pittsburgh in 1989.  Maurice "Reesie" or "Luke" Lucas played basketball for Schenley High School, Marquette University, ABA Spirits of St. Louis, Portland Trailblazers, New Jersey Nets, New York Knicks, Phoenix Suns, L.A. Lakers, and Seattle Supersonics.
TitMainTitle: Attorney Byrd Brown shaking hands with basketball player Maurice Lucas wearing championship basketball jacket inscribed "Luke," outside campaign headquarters for Byrd Brown for Congress
